member.summary: Logs the given message and the current time.

member.summary: Logs the given message with the given tag and the current time stamp.

A Tag that will be added to the message, to make it easy to distinguish between differen log messages

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.ILogger.LogId(System.String)
member.summary: Logs the given message, a message ID and the current time stamp.
member.param: The message that will be loged
member.returns: The message ID that was automatically assigned to the message. It can be used to identify a specific message.

member.summary: Logs the given message with the given tag, a message ID and the current time stamp.
member.param: The message that will be loged
A Tag that will be added to the message, to make it easy to distinguish between differen log messages
member.returns: The message ID that was automatically assigned to the message. It can be used to identify a specific message.

member.name: T:BasicxLogger.FileLogger
member.summary: File logger that contains everything needed to write a message to a log file.
member.remarks: This logger supports the following file formats: txt, log, xml and json

member.name: P:BasicxLogger.FileLogger.LogFile
member.summary: The log file of the logger.
member.remarks: The file name must contain the full path and the file extension. Supportet file extension are: .txt, .log, .json, .xml

member.name: P:BasicxLogger.FileLogger.MessageTimestamp
member.summary: Timestamp used for the logging

member.name: P:BasicxLogger.FileLogger.DefaultTag
member.summary: A default message tag that will be used if no tag is selected

member.name: P:BasicxLogger.FileLogger.TextEncoding
member.summary: The text encoding used by the logger

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class
member.param: The log file of the logger

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.FileLogger.Log(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the given message and the current time stamp to the log file.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.FileLogger.Log(BasicxLogger.LogTag,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the given message with the given tag and the current time stamp to the log file.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file
A Tag that will be added to the message, to make it easy to distinguish between differen log messages

member.summary: Writes the given message, a message ID and the current time stamp to the log file.

member.param: The message that will be writen to the file

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.Logger.log(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the given message and the current time stamp to the log file.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.Logger.log(BasicxLogger.Tag,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the given message with the given tag and the current time stamp to the log file.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file
A Tag that will be added to the message, to make it easy to distinguish between differen log messages

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.Logger.logID(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the given message, a message ID and the current time stamp to the log file.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file

Set to true if you want to make sure the message id is unique. If set to true, the loging of the message may take longer an use more ram depending on how big your log file is. When the log file exceeds the length of 1,073,741,823 chars (a little over 1GB file size) the ID will not be verifyed.
member.returns: The message ID that was automatically assigned to the message. It can be used to identify a specific message.

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.Logger.logID(BasicxLogger.Tag,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the given message with the given tag, a message ID and the current time stamp to the log file.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file
A Tag that will be added to the message, to make it easy to distinguish between differen log messages

Set to true if you want to make sure the message id is unique. If set to true, the loging of the message may take longer an use more ram depending on how big your log file is. When the log file exceeds the length of 1,073,741,823 chars (a little over 1GB file size) the ID will not be verifyed.
member.returns: The message ID that was automatically assigned to the message. It can be used to identify a specific message.

member.param: The id of the log message
The message that will be writen to the file

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.Logger.deleteLogFile
member.summary: Deletes the log file, that was created by the logger.
member.remarks: All logs will be lost. If you log again after deleting the log file, the logger will create a new file.

member.name: T:BasicxLogger.MultiLogger
member.summary: A logger that allows you to add all loggers that use the ILogger interface and log with all of them by only using one log method call.
member.remarks: The multi logger supports all logger that uses the ILogger intaterface.

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.MultiLogger.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.MultiLogger.Log(System.String)
member.summary: Logs the given message and the current time stamp with every logger that was added to the multi logger.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.MultiLogger.Log(BasicxLogger.LogTag,System.String)
member.summary: Logs the given message with the given tag and the current time stamp with every logger that was added to the multi logger.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file
A Tag that will be added to the message, to make it easy to distinguish between differen log messages

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.MultiLogger.LogId(System.String)
member.summary: Logs the given message, a message ID and the current time stamp with every logger that was added to the multi logger.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file
member.returns: The message ID that was automatically assigned to the message. It can be used to identify a specific message.

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.MultiLogger.LogId(BasicxLogger.LogTag,System.String)
member.summary: Logs the given message with the given tag, a message ID and the current time stamp with every logger that was added to the multi logger.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file
A Tag that will be added to the message, to make it easy to distinguish between differen log messages
member.returns: The message ID that was automatically assigned to the message. It can be used to identify a specific message.

The message that will be writen to the file

member.summary: Name of the table the logger will create and insert logs into

member.summary: Holds all informations about the MySqlDatabase used for logging

member.name: P:BasicxLogger.MySqlLogger.DefaultTag
member.summary: A default message tag that will be used if no tag is selected

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.MySqlLogger.#ctor(BasicxLogger.Databases.MySqlDatabase,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor to create a MySqlLogger
member.remarks: The messege formate will use the default settings with this constructor
member.param: Holds all informations about the MySqlDatabase used for logging
Name of the table the logger will log to. This table will be created by the logger.

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.MySqlLogger.#ctor(BasicxLogger.Databases.MySqlDatabase,System.String,BasicxLogger.LogTag)
member.summary: Constructor to create a MySqlLogger
member.param: Holds all informations about the MySqlDatabase used for logging
Name of the table the logger will log to. This table will be created by the logger.
A default message tag that will be used if no tag is selected

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.MySqlLogger.Log(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts the given message and the current time stamp into the log table.

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.MySqlLogger.Log(BasicxLogger.LogTag,System.String)
member.summary: Inserts the given message and the current time stamp into the log table.

member.summary: Inserts the given message and the current time stamp into the log table.
